name: market for maize grain | maize grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30596/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'maize grain', in the geography of Queensland state in Australia.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of maize grain, from the production farm to the place it is later used, i.e. maize grain feed production or maize grain processing, dry milling. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'maize grain' is a grain. It is an annual crop. The ecoinvent database also contains this product from organic, Swiss integrated and rainfed production.

The activity starts at the gate of maize grain cultivation farm.

This activity ends with the supply of 'maize grain', to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is the same as the in transforming activity for the same reference product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent the situation in Queensland state in Australia.

flow.name: maize grain
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

exchanges.description: The crops are transported by lorry (20%) and train (80%) in a total distance of 303km in the Queensland state in Australia. Transport distances based on Eady, S. (2017). Greenhouse gas emissions from the cultivation of canola oilseed in Australia, CSIRO: Clayton, Australia. With road rail mix inferred from Commonwealth of Australia (2009). Road and rail freight: competitor or complements. Information sheet 34, Australian Government, Bureau of Infrastructure, Transport and Regional Economics.

flow.name: transport, freight, lorry 16-32 metric ton, EURO4
flow.category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/492:Other land transport/4923:Freight transport by road
